stories.text:
How would you like to interact with the cloud? Like, how, in your workflow on the daily and also on the world-is-on-fire circumstances?

Would you be typing in a document? Do you do Pull Requests? How, in an ideal world, would you see things working?

I find working in the cloud to be a bit of a pain. Feels like there's everything and anything all over the place
stories.title: Ask HN: How would you like to interact with the cloud?
Gas pumps happen to be about as insecure as your typical router
Voyager 1 Signal Spotted by Earth Radio Telescopes

stories.text:
Recently read a tweet from a person complaining that most FB engineers studied for months to pass the interview, and how 'that didn't sit right'.

It made me think 'But working for a company accused of huge violations of personal privacy, as well as actual harm to vulnerable demographics.. does sit right?'

Do you work at or aspire to join a company like Meta, Alphabet, etc, and if so how do you reconcile that desire with their problematic histories.

Are you hoping to be the change? Is it about money and recognition? Or is it just not something you think about?

No judgement, I'm genuinely interested.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do people work at evil megacorps?
